column4: i need some help, my onboard wireless suddenly stopped working, iwlist scan gives no results and nm-applet picks up nothing, i had to install fresh install, the i looked at the lsmod for both and this is what is different, or mising from the non working wireless.  wlan_tkip,wlan_scan_sta how do i load manually load it/
i thought so, but it did nothing ozzloy
it can be very frustration diagnosing a problem in ubuntu

IMPORTANT: this log only lists intended actions; actions which fail due to
2008-05-19T14:15:00.000Z	laeg		dpkg problems may not be completed.
2008-05-19T14:15:00.000Z	laeg
my logs, installed and unstalled using aptitude laeg
it doesn't show anything i installed via the synaptic package manager
it even list dependancies intalled or kept laeg
do you have a feeling of what it might be? i can switch
it vexes me greatly that ubuntu gives me 3 different ways to install packages without specifying which is best and causing solutions to have a 1 in 3 chance of success.
synaptic and aptitude are the same, one is just grpahical, i use aptitude laeg
if there the same why does /var/log not list things i've just installed?
in fact it only lists things i've installed via terminal

never fear synaptic has its own history. how does apt-get and applications > add remove compare to aptitude/synaptic? i was of the understanding that aptitude removes obsolete software when installing a new package but the two former do not?
